author: axic3354
content:
Regarding the "difficulty" question, perhaps what is needed is to clarify what happens to
- `difficulty`  within the protocol (a nice option people mention is just setting it to a fixed value (1 or the last difficulty prior to the merge)
- to the EVM opcode (this could either stay equal to the protocol value or be the randao)

author: axic3354
content: So far discussions seemed to consider that the opcode must always equal to the protocol field -- can it be handled separately (adding a new field in the header for the opcode)? Are there one downsides to that?

author: axic3354
content: Ok learned a bit more about these topics since asking the question.  Maybe it would be nice (if possible) to have some explainer on the "merge todo list" for some of those points what are the underlying consideration/issues one needs to work with/around.

author: sma4321
content: on difficulty, the lower half (64?) bits could be set as with RANDAO, and the top 64 bits get set as slot number added to a constant big enough that it will still increment over the merge. Should be comparatively simple and cleanup/removal can happen later
